page.title: 07IMPORTANT LOCAL ISSUES
page.content:
Some third year pupils went around Hagley questioning villagers to compile a survey of important local issues in June 1985.
{Traffic Problems. Many were very concerned at the dangers of the so-called{Hagley Mile}, a stretch of the A458 from Birmingham which descends steeply into Upper Hagley. Some felt that one answer to the problem could be to build{escape lanes}for vehicles out of control. A more expensive alternative would be to build a bypass. 98% of those questioned nevertheless felt that this idea should be pursued as a means of reducing accidents.
